functionConfig.toolTip: go back to deep sea coral website data overview page
Show help for the attributes display

config.text:
Filters for limiting the displayed records are located in the panel left of the map. The "Scientific Name" filter allows you to type in the scientific name of interest. It will "autocomplete', displaying all options beginning with the characters you typed.

Other filters are available in the "Basic", "Taxon", and "Models" tabs below. The "Taxon" filters are intended to operate from the most general to the most specific and only offer choices pertinent to the previous selections.

Unlike the other two tabs, the "Models" tab does not filter the sample records, but instead filters the display of model output predicting the location of specified species.

Multiple filters can be applied simultaneously and note that is it possible to have a combination of filters which do not match any records.

config.text:
The panel on the right side of the map has two tabs, "Detail" and "Summary". The Detail tab allows you to page through every available record given the current map extent and any filters that have been applied. You can toggle between the tabs by clicking on the titles "Detail" and "Summary" respectively. The Summary tab displays data aggregated by fixed hexagonal areas, aka "hexbins".


If you select a point on the map, the Detail tab will display the corresponding record (note that this may take a few seconds). Switching to the Summary tab will show summary information for the hexbin containing the selected record.


If you click on a location which is covered by a hexbin but does not intersect a point, the Summary tab will automatically be selected. If you click on a location not covered by a hexbin, no summary information will be displayed but you will still be able to page through active records in the Detail tab.
